meanings.definition: A person or thing whose name one does not know or cannot recall.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I saw a whosis at the store, but I couldn't remember their name.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked about the whosis who borrowed her pen.
meanings.sent3: I bumped into a whosis at the park, and we both laughed at our forgetfulness.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious whosis in the black hat seemed to vanish into thin air.
meanings.sent5: The whosis with the bright red umbrella stood out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: Used to refer to someone or something whose name is either unknown or forgotten.
meanings.sent1: Whosis left their umbrella behind at the party.
meanings.sent2: I can't believe whosis forgot to turn off the lights again.
meanings.sent3: Whosis always seems to be misplacing their keys.
meanings.sent4: The package was addressed to whosis, but no one knew who it was for.
meanings.sent5: Whosis is the one who always brings delicious snacks to the office.

meanings.definition: A placeholder name for a person or thing whose name is unknown or forgotten.
meanings.sent1: The detective referred to the suspect as whosis during the investigation.
meanings.sent2: Whosis was the mysterious character in the novel that everyone was trying to identify.
meanings.sent3: The party invitation was addressed to whosis, adding an element of mystery.
meanings.sent4: The treasure map led to a spot marked with the name 'whosis'.
meanings.sent5: The children created a story about a magical land ruled by a wise whosis.
